intro: Sinomalus sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim sinomalus, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
